alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 5:51AM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern West Virginia, including the following counties, Northwest Pocahontas, Southeast Pocahontas, Southeast Randolph, Southeast Webster, Southeast Nicholas, and Southeast Fayette. * WHEN...From 10 AM EST this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1.5 to 3 inches of rain can be expected today. This rain will combine with melting snow to provide a threat for flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
